column2: Feature 5: Adding a deployment status and a vetting status for each application.
column15:
### Why


**As an instructor**
**I want  to be able to set and view the deployment/vetting status for each project**
**So that I can set their status anytime and also view all projects according to certain status selected**

Notes:
Deployment statuses: Dead,Development,In use,In use and wants improvement, Inactive but wants improvement, Pending
Vetting statuses:Below is a list of vetting statuses that could be provided on top of what we already have for efficient filtering of projects:
1.Vetting Pending(not yet vetted)
2.On Hold (we need something from customer during vetting phase)
3.Staff Approved(approved by the faculty during vetting phase)
4.CustomerInformed(staff has approved the project and we’ve informed the customer about acceptance and are waiting for them to confirm whether they meet our customer expectations)
5.CustomerConfirmation Received(customer has confirmed to meet our expectations)
6. Declined by Staff (Project declined by staff during vetting)
7.Declined by Customer(engagement declined by the customer after we accepted the project)
8. Declined by Customer–AvailableNext Sem (customer is not available this semester but will be available for next semester)
9.Backup(we are saving this project as a backup incase a client drops

column2: Feature 5.3: Show total no.of projects for each project status and the cumulative total in the UI
column15:
### Why


**As admin**
**I want to see the total number of projects for each status**
**So that I can the status numbers**

column2: Client: Specific Project Information Page -- Shows Relevant Information
column15:
### Why

**When a client is on their “Project A” page
They should see all information associated with a “Project A” on the page
So that they can view their project’s information**

**When a client is on their “Project A” page
They should see the following information on it:**
     * **Description**
     * **Status**
     * **Associated Pivotal Tracker Link**
     * **Associated Github**
**So they can easily go to platforms they use for project organization**

### Acceptance Criteria

```gherkin
Scenario: A logged-in user can view the Projects Information Page through the 'My Projects' index
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   When I follow "app1"
   Then I should see "app1"
   Then I should see "Status: pending"
   Then I should see "test1"
   Then I should see "f1"
   Then I should see "p1.com"
   Then I should see "repo-url1.com"
   Then I should see "deploy-url1.com"
```

column2: Client: My Projects Page -- Request Change Button
column15:
### Why

**When a client is on their “My Projects” page
They should see a project list entry with “Project Name”
And for project list entry “Project Name”
They should see a button “Request Change”
And when they click “Request Change”
They should be redirected to a Change-Request Form.
So that they can request to update this project’s information**

### Acceptance Criterion
```gherkin
 Scenario: A logged-in user can Request a change to their project through the Project Information Page
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   When I follow "app1"
   When I follow "Request Change"
   Then I should see /Request Changes for "app1"/
```

column2: Accessing the My Projects Page
column15:
### Why

**When a client is on any page of ESaaS Engagements with a Taskbar
They should see a tab labeled “My Projects”
And when they click on “My Projects”
They should be redirected to their own project listing page
So that they can manage their projects**

### Acceptance Criterion
```gherkin
 # Story ID: 169387986
 Scenario: A user that is not logged in cannot see 'My Projects' tab
   Given I am not logged in
   Then I should not see "My Projects"

 # Story ID: 169387986
 Scenario: A user that is logged in can see 'My Projects' tab
   Given I am logged in
   Then I should see "My Projects"

# Story ID: 169387986
 Scenario: A logged in user can see list of their projects in 'My Projects' tab
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   Then I should see the following apps in "apps_table" in the given order:
     | name  | description | org_id    | status  |
     | app1  | test1       | org1      | pending |
     | app2  | test2       | org1      | pending |
     | app3  | test3       | org1      | pending |
   And I should not see "app4"

```

column2: My Projects Page -- Link project names to their respective Project Information Pages
column15:
###Why

**When a client is on their “My Projects” page
They should see a project list entry with “Project Name”
And for project list entry “Project Name”
And they click “Project Name”
They should be redirected to their Project Information page
So that they can view this project’s information**

###Acceptance Criterion
```Gherkin
 # Story ID: 169387986
 Scenario: A logged in user can see list of their projects in 'My Projects' tab
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   Then I should see the following apps in "apps_table" in the given order:
     | name  | description | org_id    | status  |
     | app1  | test1       | org1      | pending |
     | app2  | test2       | org1      | pending |
     | app3  | test3       | org1      | pending |
   And I should not see "app4"

Scenario:  A logged-in client from the My Projects page clicks on a project name 
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   When I follow "app1"
   Then I should see "app1"
   Then I should see "Status: pending"
   Then I should see "test1"
   Then I should see "f1"
   Then I should see "p1.com"
   Then I should see "repo-url1.com"
   Then I should see "deploy-url1.com"
   

```

column2: 2.28: Submitting New Feature Request for Dead Apps changes status to Vetting-Pending
column15:
### Why

** As a Client **
** When I am on the "project listing page”**
** And If the status of an app is "Dead"**
** Then I should see "Request New Feature" button
** Given I have submitted a request for this app
** Then I should see the status of the app to be "Vetting Pending"**

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
   Scenario: A client submits a Change Request form for a currently dead app
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   And I press "Request New Feature" for "app3"
   And I fill in "description" with "new test description"
   And I fill in "features" with "123abc"
   And I press "Send Request"
   Then I should see "Status: vetting pending"
```
**Notes**
Link for the Edit Customer Feedback form here: 
http://localhost:3000/my_projects
Steps to find the form:
1. Navigate to this page by clicking on My Projects tab
2. Scroll down to the apps table, and find an app with status "Dead"
3. Then click on the "Request New Feature" button, and you will be redirected to Change Request form.
4. Fill in the text box for both Description and App Initial Features
5. Click "Send Request" button
6. Now the Status will be changed to "Vetting Pending"

Description and App Initial Features text area should be pre-filled with existing/previous descriptions.

Only the customer and coaches should be able to request new feature for dead apps.  Not students.

column2: 2.24: "My Projects" Index -- Ordering of  Projects Listing
column15:
### Why

** As a Client **
** When I am on "Project Listing" Page**
** And I want to see my projects are ordered by status**
** Here are the orders **
**[Development, Vetting pending, On hold, Staff approved, Customer informed, Customer confirmation received, Declined by staff, Declined by customer, Declined by customer available next sem, Back up, In use, In use and wants improvement, Inactive but wants improvement, Dead]**


### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Background: logged in, apps exist

|   app  |        status         |
|  app1  |    development        |
|  app2  |    vetting pending |
|  app3  |         on hold         |
|  app4  |          in use    |
|  app5  |          dead           |

Scenario: As a logged in Client 
Given I am on the "Project Listing" Page
And I should see "app1" before "app2"
And I should see "app2" before "app3"
And I should see "app3" before "app4"
And I should see "app4" before "app5"

```
**Notes**
Link for the Edit Customer Feedback form here: 
http://localhost:3000/my_projects
w

column2: 2.4:  Coaches should be treated as Clients
column15:
### Why

**"As a coach on ESaaS Engagements
I would like to have a MyProjects/index action that to allow me as a coach to Request Change on MyProjects just like a client can
Currently MyProjects/index shows list of projects for coach with Edit buttons instead of Request Change like for the client
"**

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A coach that is not logged in cannot see 'My Projects' tab
Given I am not logged in
Then I should not see "My Projects"

Scenario: A coach that is logged in can see 'My Projects' tab and have access to the same functionality as a client
  Given I am logged in
  Then I should see "My Projects"
  When I follow "My Projects"
  Then I should be on the my projects page
  And I should see "app-1"
  And I should see "app-description-1"
  And I should see "Request Change"
  When I follow "Request Change"
  Then I should be on the new edit request page for app-1

```

column2: Bug Fix: show only the projects of current logged in user under MyProjects
column15:

1. Log in
2. Click on My Projects Tab
3. Scroll through projects listing

### Expected 
User should see all their projects

### Actual
User sees all projects/apps on Esaas Engagements (not only their own)

column2: 2.7: Submitting a project update request using the Change-Request form
column15:
### Why

**As a** client 
**I want** to be able to submit a Change-Request Form with specified edits to the project description and features
**So that**  I can request new features and/or updates to be made to my projects


### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
 Scenario: A logged in user will see the "Request Change" button change to "Update Request" when a Change Request is submitted
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   Then I should not see "Update Request"
   And I follow "app1"
   And I follow "Request Change"
   And I fill in "description" with "123abc"
   And I fill in "features" with "123abc"
   And I press "Send Request"
   Then I should see "Update Request"
   When I follow "My Projects"
   Then I should see "Update Request"
```

column2: 2.9: Change-Request form fields pre-filled w/ relevant information (initial request)
column15:
### Why
** As a Client of Esaas Engagements **
** I want to be able to create an edit request for a project via the Change Request form and I should see an editable box with the current descriptions and features pre-filled **
** So that I can easily edit and/or append any new additions to the existing descriptions and features.**

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
 Scenario: A logged in user can view the Projects Information Page through the 'My Projects' index
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   When I follow "app1"
   Then I should see "app1"
   Then I should see "Status: pending"
   Then I should see "test1"
   Then I should see "f1"
   Then I should see "p1.com"
   Then I should see "repo-url1.com"
   Then I should see "deploy-url1.com"
   When I follow "Request Change"
   Then I should see "app1"
   Then I should see "test1"
   Then I should see "f1"
   Then I should see "p1.com"
   Then I should see "repo-url1.com"
   Then I should see "deploy-url1.com"
   And I fill in "description" with "123abc"
   And I fill in "features" with "123abcd"
   And I press "Send Request"
   When I follow "Update Request"
   Then I should see "app1"
   Then I should see "123abc"
   Then I should see "123abcd"
   Then I should see "p1.com"
   Then I should see "p1.com"
   Then I should see "repo-url1.com"
   Then I should see "deploy-url1.com"
   Then I should see "deploy-url1.com"
```

**Notes**

column2: 2.20 Add Delete Change Request Functionality
column15:
### Why

** As a client of Esaas Engagements 
 I want there to be a "Delete Request" button  on the Change Request form of a project with an existing submitted Change Request form
So that I can delete the existing Change Request if I no longer want it**

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A logged-in client can delete a Change Request on the Update/Edit Request Page
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   And I follow "app1"
   And I follow "Request Change"
   And I fill in "description" with "123abc"
   And I fill in "features" with "123abc"
   And I press "Send Request"
   Then I should see "Update Request"
   When I follow "Update Request"
   And I press "Delete Request"
   Then I should see "Successfully deleted edit request for: app1"
```

column2: 2.23 Add Alert icons in My Projects page for Reviewed App Edit Requests Notifications and for Customer Iteration Feedback Requests
column15:
### Why
**As a client**
** I want the My Projects page to notify me when a change request which I submitted for my project has been reviewed by staff (a Coach user) **
**So that I will know about the status of my project requests **

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: Client can view and link to requested Itearation Form through dropdown menu
  When I follow "My Projects"
  Then I should see "We want your feedback!"
  When I click on the "feedbacks" icon
  Then I should see "app1: Iteration 1 Feedback Form"
  Then I should see "ap6: Iteration 2 Feedback Form"
  When I follow "app1: Iteration 1 Feedback Form"
  Then I should see "Edit Customer Feedback"

Scenario: Client can view and link to reviewed requests through icon dropdown menu
  Given I am logged in
  When I follow "My Projects"
  Then I should see "Your request has been reviewed!"
  When I click on the "requests" icon
  Then I should see "View Feedback for app6"
  And I should not see "View Feedback for app1"
  When I follow "View Feedback for app6"
  Then I should see "Edit Request for app6"
  Then I should see "test6"
  Then I should see "f6"

**Notes**


Link for the Edit Customer Feedback form here: 
http://localhost:3000/engagements/2/iterations/2/edit
Note: An alert will appear for iteration feedback forms only if they have been requested by staff

Link for the App Information page here:
http://localhost:3000/apps/2
Note: An alert will appear for requests only if they have been reviewed by staff


Steps to find the form:
1. Navigate to My Projects index page,  and you should be able to see the icons.
2. If there are reviewed requests and pending iteration feedback forms, then you will see "A staff has reviewed your request!" and "We want your feedback!" as notifications on each icon. 
3. Click or hover your cursor on either icon, you will see a drop-down list of reviewed requests or pending iteration feedback forms.
4. Click on any items in the drop-down list, then you will be redirected to the required page.

Only the customer and coaches should be able to view the icons. Not students.

```

column2: Add  "Send Request" Button to the Change-Request Form
column15:
### Why

** As a Client **
**I want to see a button that says "Send Request" in Change-Request From.**
**When I fill out the new description and features.**
**I want to click the "Sent Request" Button**
**So that I can submit my Change Request for Staff to review.**

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: As a logged in Client 
Given I am on Change Request Page
Then I should see "Send Request" button
When I fill in  Description with "new description"
And I fill in App Features with "new features"
And  I press "Send Request"
Then I should see an alert that says "Your app edit request has been submitted to staff for review and approval. Staff has not yet reviewed/approved this request."
```
**Notes**
Link for the Change Request  form here: 
http://localhost:3000/my_project_edit/97/new
Steps to find the form:
1. Navigate to this page by clicking My Projects tab
2. Follow an app, and click on "Request Change" button
3. Description and App Features fields should be pre-filled with existing ones.



Only the customer and coaches should be able to view the Send Request button. Not Student.

column2: 2.13: Banner on the Project Information Page showing Change-Request status
column15:
### Why

** As a logged-in Client of Esaas Engagements **
**I want to be able to see the status of my submitted change request form on the respective Project Information Page as a banner alert.**
** So that I can quickly find out the status of my Change Request. **
        
### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A logged-in client clicks on the Project information page of a project for which a change request form has been submitted but not reviewed by Staff
Given I am logged in
When I follow "My Projects"
And I follow "app1"
Then I should see "Staff has not yet reviewed/approved this request."

Scenario: A logged-in client clicks on the Project information page of a project for which a change request form has been submitted and reviewed by Staff with feedback
Given I am logged in
When I follow "My Projects"
And I follow "app5"
Then I should see "Staff has reviewed and left feedback on your edit request. Kindly review staff feedback and update the request."
```

column2: 2.11: Submitting a Change-Request Form Redirects User to the Respective Project Information Page
column15:
### Why

** As a logged-in Client of Esaas Engagements **
**I want to be redirected to the Project Information page (apps/:app_id) of the corresponding project when I submit a change request form for that project**
** So that I can more easily confirm that my submission was successful and can see the latest change request and its status reflected in the project information page. **
        
### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A logged-in client submits a Request Change form
Given I am on the  Change Request Page for "app1"
When I fill in  Description with "new description"
And I fill in App Features with "new features"
And  I press "Send Request"
Then I should see  "Your app edit request has been submitted to staff for review and approval."
And I should see "Edit Request for app1"
And I should see "Request Status: submitted"
```

column2: 2.22: Buttons that say "Request Change" => "Update Request" when a Change-Request has been made for that project
column15:
### Why

** As a Client of Esaas Engagements **
**I want the 'Request Change' button for any project which I have submitted an Edit Request for that has not yet been fully resolved by a Coach to change to  'Update Request'**
** So that I can easily identify my projects for which I have already submitted an edit request. **

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A logged in user will see the "Request Change" button change to "Update Request" when a Change Request is submitted
   Given I am logged in
   When I follow "My Projects"
   Then I should not see "Update Request"
   And I follow "app1"
   And I follow "Request Change"
   And I fill in "description" with "123abc"
   And I fill in "features" with "123abc"
   And I press "Send Request"
   Then I should see "Update Request"
   When I follow "My Projects"
   Then I should see "Update Request" for "app1"
```

column2: 2.27: Staff App Edit Requests Review Portal
column15:
### Why

** As a Coach **
**I want to be able to view an App Edit (Feature Change) Request **
** So that I can approve the Edit Request or give feedback to the client to revise the Edit Request**

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A logged-in coach user can view an App Edit (Feature Change) Request through the 'App Edit Requests' index
  Given I am logged in
  When I follow "App Edit Requests"
  When I follow the App Edit Request with id 102
  Then I should see /Edit request for "app2"/
```

**Notes**
App Edit Requests controller is named MyApprovalRequestsController

 Given I am not logged in

Given I am not logged in

column2: 3.1 Request feedback from customer
column15:
### Why

** As a Coach user **
**I want to be able to request iteration feedback on a project from the client **
** So that I can determine if the client is satisfied with the deliverable and has any feedback on the delivered features. **

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: As a logged in Coach user 
Given I am on the "Project Information Page"
Then I should see a "Request Feedback" button

Given I am on the "Project Information Page" for <Project Name>
When I follow "Request Feedback" 
Then I should see "New Iteration for <Project Name>"
```



**Notes**
Link for the Add Iteration form here: 
http://localhost:3000/engagements/2/iterations/new
Navigate to this page by clicking on an app from Apps.
Scroll down to the Engagements section of the application/project information page where you will find a table.
Then click on the date in the "Started" column of the table. You will now be redirected to the new iteration form page.

column2: 3.2 Client View of Feedback Request Form
column15:
### Why

** As a Client **
**I want to see a banner alert on the My Projects page  and the Project Information page that says "Staff has requested feedback from you. Fill it out (hyperlink to form).”**
** So that I know when feedback for my project deliverable is requested by Staff  **

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: As a logged in Client 
Given I am on the "Project Information Page"
Then I should see "Staff has requested feedback from you. Fill it out. "

Given I am on the "Project Information Page" for <Project Name>
When I follow "Staff has requested feedback from you. Fill it out. "
Then I should see "Iteration Feedback for <Project Name>"
```
**Notes**
Link for the Edit Customer Feedback form here: 
http://localhost:3000/engagements/2/iterations/2/edit
Steps to find the form:
1. Navigate to this page by clicking on an app from Apps.
2. Scroll down to the Engagements section of the application/project information page where you will find a table.
3. Then click on the date in the "Started" column of the table. You will now be redirected to the new iteration form page.
4. Then Click the Add Iteration button and Add iteration
5. Click on the edit button beside the Iteration in the table
You will be redirected to the  Edit Customer Feedback form.
Iteration number and end date should be locked for clients. 

Feedback Form Fields:
How well are you able to engage with student score 1-5
Pre-filled questions : json results of the form stored in one single column in json form

Only the customer and coaches should be able to view the feedback information. Not students.

column2: 3.5 Restrict Engagements to Coaches and Project Owners Only

column2: 2.29: Allow coaches to review, leave feedback, and/or approve edit requests.
column15:
### Why
(Completed as a side effect of one of the previous stories; including here for documentation)

As a Coach on ESaaS Engagements
I would like to be able to review a customer's edit requests for an application, give a feedback, and/or approve their requests, so that I can inform the client about the acceptability of their requests
### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: A coach should be able to see "App Edit Requests" tab
    Given I am logged in
    Then I should see "App Edit Requests"
Scenario: A logged in coach user can see list of App Edit Requests in 'App Edit Requests' tab
    Given I am logged in
    When I follow "App Edit Requests 2"
    Then I should see "app1" before "app2"
    And I should not see "app4"
    And I should not see "app3"
Scenario: A logged in coach user can view an App Edit (Feature Change) Request through the 'App Edit Requests' index
    Given I am logged in
    When I follow "App Edit Requests"
    When I follow the App Edit Request with id 102
    Then I should see /Edit request for "app2"/
...
```

column2: 4.1 Student Associations w/ Engagement
column15:
As a coach,
So that I can associate the relevant students to a given project for the customer
I would like to have a field in the form where I can assign student names
And when I add students to the form, they will be associated with the given engagement in database.

As a coach, or as a owning client,
So that I can easily contact the corresponding user via email
I would like a link from the information page that includes email address

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Scenario: As a logged in Coach
    Given I follow "<Project Name>"
    And I create a new engagement for "<Project Name>"
    Then I should see "Student Names"
    When I fill in the engagement fields as follows:
        | field | value |
        | Team Number | <Team Number> |
    And I select "<Student Names>" as Team members
    And I press "Create Engagement"
    Then I should see "Engagement was successfully created."

Scenario: As a logged in Coach
    Given I follow "<Project Name>"
    Then I should see links to the contact email information
...
```

column2: 2.30 Provide a filter option on AppEditRequest page that uses three different request statuses: submitted, reviewed, and resubmitted
column15:
### Why 
(Completed as a side effect of one of the previous stories; including here for documentation)

As a coach on ESaaS Engagements
I would like to have a filter option on my AppEditRequests page that would enable me to filter requests based on their statuses (submitted, reviewed, resubmitted) so that I can easily see which customer requests still need my feedback.

### Acceptance Criteria
```gherkin
Given I am logged in
  Then I should see "App Edit Requests 2"
  When I follow "My Projects"
  Then I should be on the my projects page
  When I follow "app5"
  Then I should not see "Your app edit request has been submitted to staff for review and approval. Staff has not yet reviewed/approved this request."
  When I follow "Back"
  And I follow Request Change with id 105
  Then I should see "There are currently no edit requests for your app. You can request new edits for you app here."
  When I fill in "description" with "This is app5"
  And I fill in "features" with "login, logout"
  Then I press "Send Request"
  Then I should see "Your app edit request has been submitted to staff for review and approval. Staff has not yet reviewed/approved this request."

  Then I should see "App Edit Requests 3"
  When I follow "App Edit Requests"
  Then I should see "app1"
  Then I should see "app2"
  Then I should see "app5"

  And I follow the App Edit Request with id 105
  Then I should see "This is app5"
  And I should see "login, logout"
  When I fill in "feedback" with "I can only do login"
  And I press "Post Feedback"
  Then I should see "App Edit Requests 2"
  And I follow the App Edit Request with id 105
  Then I should see "reviewed"

  When I follow "My Projects"
  Then I should be on the my projects page
  When I follow "app5"
  Then I should see "Staff has reviewed and left feedback on your edit request. Kindly review staff feedback and update the request."
  And I should see "I can only do login"

  Given I follow "Update Edits"
  When I press "Update Request"
  Then I should see "There were no updates to edits made."

  Given I fill in "features" with "login"
  And I press "Update Request"
  Then I should see "Successfully updated edit request."
  And I should see "You resubmitted an edit request after staff left feedback but staff has not yet reviewed your updates."
  Then I should see "App Edit Requests 3"

  When I follow "App Edit Requests"
  Then I should see "app1"
  Then I should see "app5"
  And I uncheck "resubmitted"
  And I press "Filter Requests"
  Then I should not see "app5"
  And I check "resubmitted"

  And I uncheck "submitted"
  Then I press "Filter Requests"
  Then I should not see "app1"
  
  And I follow the App Edit Request with id 105
  And I press "Post Feedback and Approve"
  Then I should see /You have successfully approved edits for "app5"./
  Then I should see "App Edit Requests 2"
  And I press "Filter Requests"
  Then I should not see "app5"
```

Notes
Link for the App Edit Requests index page:
https://esaas-demo.herokuapp.com/my_approval_requests?status%5Bresubmitted_status%5D=1&status%5Breviewed_status%5D=1&status%5Bsubmitted_status%5D=1
Steps to filter:
Navigate to this page by clicking on App Edit Requests  tab:
Check/uncheck request status check box.

column2: CD setup
GitHub login/auth API has changed; must make minor change to SSO flow
column15:
Application (ESaaS Engagements (production)) used an access token (with the User-Agent Faraday v0.15.4) as part of a query parameter to access an endpoint through the GitHub API.

https://api.github.com/user

Please use the Authorization HTTP header instead as using the `access_token` query parameter is deprecated.

Depending on your API usage, we'll be sending you this email reminder on a monthly basis.

Visit https://developer.github.com/changes/2020-02-10-deprecating-auth-through-query-param for more information about suggested workarounds and removal dates.
column20:
The access_token issue was resolved in story #177124942 (Fix Invalid credential upon login in production environment).

PR: https://github.com/zfred219/esaas-engagements/pull/18

Ed post: https://edstem.org/us/courses/3809/discussion/287862

The problem came from the omniauth-github gem sending access_token via query during the callback phase. After researching around, I found that there was no way to set that other than overriding the specific function of the gem that is responsible for that. 

Since the problem was fairly recent, updating the gem to a newer version did not solve the problem and raised some compatibility issues, so the current version of gem from the golden repo is kept unchanged.  (enjiaxu - Mar 31, 2021)

Feature 3: Add projects more easily
"Comment" model seems to have broken logic
column15: The logic in the Comments model is highly suspect/makes little sense, and in addition if you try to manually call `ActiveRecord::Base#destroy` on a user instance, it fails because `User::PostedComment` is undefined (trying to run the pre-delete callbacks, presumably).  Someone needs to document, write tests for, and validate what this model does, including making sure there is a test for destroying a user that fails in the presence of this bug and passes when it's fixed.
